events.name: Hello to Android N
events.description: https://events.withgoogle.com/android-n-hello/ We invite your team to learn about the new features and APIs in Android N. We welcome Mobile App Developers, App Owners and Product Managers to attend this session, so they can prepare their app for the next Android release.  This is also a great opportunity to meet and interact with Android engineers from Google HQ and Developer Relations team in Google Singapore. Registration is free and required, and limited to 80 participants. Register here: https://events.withgoogle.com/android-n-hello/
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: PyData Meetup - April 2016 - Sentiment Analysis using Stanford's CoreNLP
events.description: Agenda  • 6:45pm - 7:00pm Networking • 7:00pm - 8:30pm Presentation: Sentiment Analysis using Stanford's CoreNLP by Aditya Shankar Synopsis: There is more to Text Mining than TDM and TF-IDF. Come explore the world of Sentiment Analysis using Advanced Text Mining techniques with cutting edge tools like Stanford's CoreNLP and analysing it's output using Python. Speaker: Aditya Shankar is a Lecturer in the Intelligent Systems practice at the Institute of Systems Science in the National University of Singapore. He started his career consulting for Microsoft in Redmond, WA, Nike in Portland, OR and T-Mobile in Seattle, WA. He then moved on to work for companies in the Healthcare domain, mostly healthcare providers in Tennessee. He also consulted for the Enterprise Data Services team of some of the oldest and most well-known banks in Scotland. In his varied career, Aditya has had the opportunity to work in the Business Software & Services, High-Tech, Healthcare Payers and Providers, Retail and Financial Services industries. He holds a Bachelor’s degree in Physics and Mathematics and a Master’s Degree in Business Analytics • 8:30pm - 8:35pm Lucky Draw sponsored by O'Reilly Updates • PyCon Singapore 2016 is happening on June 23-25. See https://pycon.sg/ Join us on Facebook and Twitter  https://www.facebook.com/groups/pydatasg/ https://www.twitter.com/pydatasg  Sponsors     Group Sponsor
events.location: Skyscanner, 39 Robinson Road, #09-01 Robinson Point, Singapore 068911

events.name: Getting Started with ioT (with ESPert)
events.description:
In the workshop, participants will get to experience for themselves the fundamental elements of the Internet-of-Things such as sensors, micro-controllers, communication protocols, cloud, data visualization & analytics. They will have a hands-on session building for themselves a very simple IoT service and visualizing with augmented reality. No programming is expected.

Participants should bring a laptop computer with Wi-Fi connection and a mobile phone (min 3G; iOS or Android).

Register Here
https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/creative-crew-talks-apr-meeting-2016-tickets-24129724656

events.name: Book Club: Seven Languages in Seven Weeks – Haskell
events.description:
Read Seven Languages in Seven Weeks. This week we'll be covering the chapters on Haskell.  


"Just as each new spoken language can make you smarter and increase your options, each programming language increases your mental tool kit, adding new abstractions you can throw at each new problem. " How Book Club Works1. Read the chapter before you come to the meetup.2. Find something in the chapter you found interesting and maybe research it a little more.3. At the meetup, we go around the room and each person gets a chance to tell the group about the thing they found interesting.4. Group discussion and banter ensues! Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence: 244A Tanjong Katong RdSingapore  437032Singapore Doors open at 6:30, meetup starts at 7. Bring snacks and drinks of your choice! Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore
